reviews.text: This is another Montjuic park, there are many small parks in this area. It is a nice park with interesting walkways and a number of statues. Picnic on the lawns or take your children to the playground. The cable car passes overhead. The gardens are a memorial to Catalan poet, Joan Brossa

The beautiful metropolis, Barcelona, has many squares, parks and gardens, who are oasis in the city.
Jardins de Joan Brossa is one of them.
It's a wonderful garden/park, situated in Montjuïc.
Joan Brossa was an important Catalan poet.

This was formerly a Theme Park, the Montjuic Fun Fair and is a relatively new garden with old plantings. Slightly wild which I think is the intention, too much to keep spotlessly tidy. We didn't fully look around this garden as we were moving on to another garden we wanted to see. So a return visit one day. 
The musical bellows were fun even for the bigger kids.
More than one entrance, probably the easiest from the Montjuic funicular.
